latest news.eng_title: Price of Gasoline Increases After 10 Weeks of Decline
latest news.summary: After a 10-week decline, the price of COR 95 gasoline has started to increase. Over the next three days, gasoline will be sold for 22.36 lei/liter, a 0.07 lei increase from Friday. Diesel fuel prices remain stable at 19.06 lei/liter. According to the National Agency for Energy Regulation, the decrease in pump prices was due to lower Platts quotations and a strong leu/dollar exchange rate. However, with recent changes in these factors, the Agency notes that 'This fact in the next period can lead to price recovery.' The Agency will continue to monitor international oil exchanges and ensure the transparency and accuracy of fuel price calculations.
latest news.title: Price of gasoline goes up after 10 weeks of decline

latest news.eng_title: How Much Are WI Gas Prices Are Going Down, And Why
latest news.summary: Gas prices in Wisconsin are decreasing due to the end of the summer travel season and global oil market fluctuations. According to AAA data, a gallon of regular gasoline cost an average of $3.01 on Thursday, down from $3.32 a month ago and $3.63 a year ago. Nationally, gas prices have plummeted 13 percent, or about 50 cents a gallon, from an April 2024 peak. Experts attribute the decline to weakening demand for crude oil from China, robust supply from U.S. and other global producers, and the annual switch to less-expensive winter fuel blends. However, experts note that there are some wild cards that could cause gas prices to tick back upward, such as hurricanes or an economic surge prompted by expected cuts in interest rates.
latest news.title: How Much Are WI Gas Prices Are Going Down, And Why

latest news.eng_title: How Much Are MN Gas Prices Are Going Down, And Why
latest news.summary: Gas prices in Minnesota are decreasing due to the end of the summer travel season and global oil market fluctuations. According to AAA data, a gallon of regular gasoline costs an average of $3.07, down from $3.31 a month ago and $3.93 a year ago. Nationally, gas prices have plummeted 13 percent, or about 50 cents a gallon, from an April 2024 peak. Experts attribute the decline to a sharp drop in the price of Brent crude oil, weakening demand from China, and a robust supply from U.S. and other global producers. Timothy Fitzgerald, a professor of business economics at Texas Tech University, said, 'There's pretty good supply and not much demand.' The annual switch to less-expensive winter fuel blends is also contributing to the lower prices. However, experts warn that disruptions, such as hurricanes or an economic surge, could cause gas prices to tick back upward.
latest news.title: How Much Are MN Gas Prices Are Going Down, And Why

latest news.eng_title: Gas Prices Down 18.9 Percent from One Year Ago
latest news.summary: The statewide gas price average in Texas is $2.78 per gallon, a 65-cent decrease from last year. According to AAA Texas, gas prices are 18.9% lower than one year ago. Daniel Armbruster, AAA Texas spokesperson, said, 'Fuel price averages are expected to continue to move lower as Autumn begins.' The national average price for a gallon of regular unleaded is $3.22, which is 66 cents less per gallon compared to last year. Gas demand has fallen to a six-week low, and total domestic gasoline stocks have increased. West Texas Intermediate crude remains at $70 per barrel, 19% lower than the 2024 high price of $86.91.
latest news.title: Gas Prices Down 18.9 Percent from One Year Ago

latest news.eng_title: Gas prices up $0.25, diesel down by $0.91
latest news.summary: According to Petrojam, gasoline prices will increase by $0.25, with 90-octane selling for $175.73 per litre and 87-octane selling for $166.71 per litre. Diesel fuel prices will decrease by $0.91, with ultra-low sulphur diesel selling for $170.27 per litre. Kerosene prices have decreased by $2.97, selling for $152.27 per litre. Propane liquid petroleum prices have decreased by $0.25, selling for $70.54 per litre, while butane liquid petroleum prices have increased by $0.25, selling for $80.73 per litre.
latest news.title: Gas prices up $0.25, diesel down by $0.91

latest news.eng_title: RI Gas Prices Are Going Down: Here's Why
latest news.summary: Gas prices in Rhode Island have decreased due to the end of the summer travel season and global oil market fluctuations. According to AAA data, a gallon of regular gasoline costs an average of $3.06, down from $3.13 a week ago, $3.34 a month ago, and $3.78 a year ago. Nationally, gas prices have plummeted 13 percent, or about 50 cents a gallon, from an April 2024 peak. Experts attribute the decline to weakening demand for crude oil from China, robust supply from U.S. and other global producers, and the annual switch to less-expensive winter fuel blends. However, experts warn that lower prices may not continue if there are disruptions, such as hurricanes, or an economic surge prompted by expected cuts in interest rates. As Timothy Fitzgerald, a professor of business economics at Texas Tech University, said, 'There's pretty good supply and not much demand.'
latest news.title: RI Gas Prices Are Going Down: Here's Why

latest news.eng_title: NY Gas Prices Are Going Down: Here's Why
latest news.summary: Gas prices in New York are decreasing due to the end of the summer travel season and global oil market fluctuations. According to AAA data, a gallon of regular gasoline in New York cost an average of $3.347 on Wednesday, down from $3.402 a week ago, $3.545 a month ago, and $3.920 a year ago. Nationally, gas prices have plummeted 13 percent, or about 50 cents a gallon, from an April 2024 peak. Experts attribute the decline to weakening demand for crude oil from China, robust supply from U.S. and other global producers, and the annual switch to less-expensive winter fuel blends. Timothy Fitzgerald, a professor of business economics at Texas Tech University, noted that 'there's pretty good supply and not much demand.' AAA spokesperson Andrew Gross warned that 'there are some wild cards that we're watching,' including potential disruptions from hurricanes and an economic surge prompted by expected cuts in interest rates.
latest news.title: NY Gas Prices Are Going Down: Here's Why

latest news.summary: The national average price of gasoline has decreased for a seventh week, down 6.9 cents from last week, and stands at $3.15 per gallon. In New York state, prices are down 5.6 cents averaging $3.31 per gallon. According to GasBuddy data, the national average is down 26.2 cents per gallon compared to a month ago and 70.5 cents lower than a year ago. Patrick De Haan, head of petroleum analysis at GasBuddy, said, 'Gasoline prices continue to crumble across nearly the entire nation, with average prices below $3 per gallon in 18 states.' He also noted that the outlook is bright for the national average to continue to make a run at falling to $2.99 per gallon for the first time since 2021. However, refinery maintenance and outages at California refineries have led to tight supply and rising prices in California. According to GasBuddy demand data, U.S. retail gasoline demand increased 0.2 percent during the week ending Saturday, Sept. 14.
latest news.title: Gas prices keep going down

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices are plummeting. Experts explain why.
news knowledge.summary: Gas prices have plummeted about 13% from a 2024 peak in April, with the national average price of a gallon of gas standing at $3.20, according to AAA data. Experts forecast that the national average price will likely drop below $3 per gallon for the first time since May 2021. The drop in prices is due to sluggish demand for gas and a sharp decline in the price of crude oil. Patrick de Haan, head of petroleum analysis at GasBuddy, said, 'Gas prices continue to crumble across the entire nation. The outlook is bright.' The decline in prices is expected to continue, with nearly every state east of the Rockies now having some retail outlets selling gas below $3 a gallon. However, experts warn that possible disruptions such as hurricane season or an economic surge could undo the anticipated price relief. By the early part of next year, demand for gasoline is expected to swell, turning seasonal fluctuations against consumers.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices are plummeting. Experts explain why.

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices: New lows at the pumps to start the work week
news knowledge.summary: Gas prices in the US have continued to fall, with the national average for a gallon of regular gas dropping to $3.208, according to AAA. This is the lowest national average since January, and 17 states now have an average price under $3 per gallon. Despite recent decreases, gas prices have fluctuated throughout the year and vary significantly among states. Gas prices remain a vital topic heading into the 2024 presidential election, with Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee, needing to address the issue and its impact on the economy and people's finances. In the Delmarva region, Delaware has the cheapest gas prices, with an average cost of $2.987 per gallon, while Washington, D.C. has the highest prices, at $3.426 per gallon.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices: New lows at the pumps to start the work week

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas Prices Continue to Drop Ahead of Fall
news knowledge.summary: The national average price for a gallon of gas has dropped to $3.24, down six cents from last week. The decrease is attributed to low demand and falling oil costs. According to Andrew Gross, AAA spokesperson, 'There are an ever-increasing number of states east of the Rockies that have some retail gas locations selling regular for under $3 a gallon, so drivers will have more in their wallets with autumn approaching.' This trend is positive for fall travelers, and if the national average falls below $3, it will be the first time since May 2021.
news knowledge.title: Gas Prices Continue to Drop Ahead of Fall

news knowledge.eng_title: US Gas Price Map Shows States Where Costs Falling Fastest
news knowledge.summary: According to the American Automobile Association (AAA), the national average for gas prices in the US is $3.242 per gallon, a decrease from last month's average of $3.443 per gallon and a larger drop from September 2023's average of $3.836 per gallon. Gas prices have fallen most significantly in Western states, with Arizona experiencing the biggest drop, down by $1.073 from $4.490 to $3.417. Oregon and Washington have also seen significant drops, with prices falling by 97 cents and 91 cents respectively. In contrast, Hawaii has seen the lowest recorded fall, with gas prices only 16 cents cheaper now than in September 2023. AAA spokesperson Andrew Gross said, 'There are an ever-increasing number of states east of the Rockies that have some retail gas locations selling regular for under $3 a gallon, so drivers will have more in their wallets with autumn approaching.'
news knowledge.title: US Gas Price Map Shows States Where Costs Falling Fastest

news knowledge.eng_title: Map shows states with gasoline average under $3 per gallon
news knowledge.summary: As of Tuesday, the average national gas price was $2.36 per gallon, with 11 states having averages below $3 per gallon, according to AAA. The national average has fallen from $3.33 a week ago and $3.83 on September 10, 2023. AAA credits 'plunging crude oil prices' and 'low U.S. demand for gas' for the decline. Mark Jenkins, a spokesman for AAA Auto Club Group, said that 'about 23 percent of Florida retailers have prices below $3 a gallon,' and that number is likely to grow. Marie Dodds, the government and public affairs director for AAA in Oregon and Idaho, noted that 'gas prices typically fall after Labor Day' and 'should continue to fall in the coming weeks.' The most expensive price-per-gallon averages continue to be seen on the West Coast, with California having the highest state average at $4.73.
news knowledge.title: Map shows states with gasoline average under $3 per gallon

news knowledge.eng_title: Weekly Fuel Report: Gasoline Trend Lower This Week
news knowledge.summary: According to AAA, the price of regular unleaded gasoline in Iowa fell three cents to an average of $3.11, while the national average decreased by four cents to $3.32. The global crude oil prices also dropped, with West Texas Intermediate (WTI) falling by $5.38 to $69.88 and Brent crude oil decreasing by $5.82 to $73.38. In Iowa, retail diesel prices decreased by 2 cents to $3.44, which is 25 cents lower than the national average of $3.69. Wholesale ethanol prices remained steady at $2.16, while natural gas prices rose by seven cents to $2.19.
news knowledge.title: Weekly Fuel Report: Gasoline Trend Lower This Week

news knowledge.eng_title: Falling gas prices are yet another blow to the Trump campaign
news knowledge.summary: Former President Donald Trump has been using high gas prices to attack Vice President Kamala Harris, claiming they had 'soared' to $8 a gallon. However, fact-checkers have dismissed this as false. While Trump is not entirely wrong, as gas prices did hit a high of $4.93 a gallon in mid-2022, they have been declining steadily for the last five months. According to the American Automobile Association, the national average price for a gallon of gas was $3.30, a 6-cent decline from the previous week. Andrew Gross, a spokesperson for AAA, said 'There are now 10 states with gasoline averages below $3 a gallon, which means thousands of retail outlets east of the Rockies are selling gas at similarly low prices.' This trend is likely to continue, with low gas demand and a current cost of oil at about $70 per barrel.
news knowledge.title: Falling gas prices are yet another blow to the Trump campaign

news knowledge.eng_title: SD County Gas Prices Inching Up, But Relief from Cheaper Winter-Blend Fuel on the Way
news knowledge.summary: The average price of a gallon of self-serve regular gasoline in San Diego County increased by 0.4 cents to $4.686 on Monday, but is still 69.1 cents lower than last year. The national average price dropped by 0.2 cents to $3.331, its 17th decrease in the last 19 days. According to Andrew Gross, an AAA national public relations manager, 'The arrival of September means cheaper winter-blend gasoline is almost here, which always helps take pressure off pump prices.' The national average price has dropped $1.685 since rising to a record $5.016 on June 14, 2022.
news knowledge.title: SD County Gas Prices Inching Up, But Relief from Cheaper Winter-Blend Fuel on the Way

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas Prices Lower This Holiday Weekend
news knowledge.summary: According to AAA, the average price of regular unleaded gasoline in Iowa fell to $3.14, a four-cent decrease from the previous week. This is 43 cents lower than the price one year ago. The national average price of gasoline is $3.36, down three cents from last week. Meanwhile, the price of global crude oil rose by $2.60 per barrel, with WTI crude currently at $75.26 and Brent crude at $79.20. In Iowa, retail diesel prices fell 3 cents to $3.46, which is 25 cents lower than the national average of $3.71. Wholesale ethanol prices remained steady at $2.16, while natural gas prices rose 7 cents to $2.12/MMbtu.
news knowledge.title: Gas Prices Lower This Holiday Weekend

news knowledge.eng_title: Pace of Gas Price Decline Slows as Labor Day Weekend Arrives
news knowledge.summary: Gas prices are still falling, but at a slower pace than recently, with the national average dipping just two cents to $3.36 since last week. A slight uptick in gas demand may be due to summer travelers, while a storm system forming in the Atlantic may pose a threat to falling gas prices. AAA spokesperson Andrew Gross said, 'Since today, 8/29, is my birthday, my wish is that this potential tropical storm fizzles quickly, and the arrival of September means cheaper winter-blend gasoline is almost here, which always helps take pressure off pump prices.' The national average for L2 commercial electricity did not budge at 34 cents per kilowatt hour. Gas demand rose last week from 9.19 million b/d to 9.30, while total domestic gasoline stocks fell from 220.2 to 218.4 million barrels. Unspectacular gasoline demand and falling oil costs may cause pump prices to slide further.
news knowledge.title: Pace of Gas Price Decline Slows as Labor Day Weekend Arrives
